diseases.description: Foot-and-mouth disease (FMD) is a highly contagious viral disease that affects cloven-hoofed animals, including cattle, sheep, goats, and pigs. It is caused by the foot-and-mouth disease virus (FMDV), which belongs to the Picornaviridae family. The disease is characterized by fever, blisters in the mouth and on the feet, and can lead to significant economic losses in livestock production.
diseases.symptoms: Animals with FMD typically have a fever and blisters on the tongue and lips, in and around the mouth, on the mammary glands, and around the hooves..
diseases.treatment: There is no specific treatment for FMD. In endemic countries antibiotic therapy may be used to control secondary bacterial infection of ulcers but recovery takes several weeks to months. .
diseases.prevention: Quarantine, Isolate sick animals from the herd to minimize disease spread. - Isolation should be at a minimum 28-30 days (which equals two incubation periods for FMD).

diseases.description: Anthrax is a serious infectious disease caused by the bacterium Bacillus anthracis. It primarily affects livestock and wild animals, but it can also infect humans. The disease is characterized by the formation of spores that can survive in the environment for long periods.

Anthrax is a serious infectious disease caused by the bacterium Bacillus anthracis. It primarily affects livestock and wild animals, but it can also infect humans. The disease is characterized by the formation of spores that can survive in the environment for long periods.
diseases.treatment: Anthrax in animals is often difficult to treat, and penicillin is the antibiotic of choice
diseases.prevention:
vaccination
Proper Disposal
Preventing Scavengers
Steralization

diseases.description: Foot disease is a term used to describe various conditions affecting the feet of animals, particularly livestock. These conditions can include foot rot, foot abscesses, and other infections that cause pain, swelling, and lameness.

Swine erysipelas is a bacterial disease caused by the bacterium Erysipelothrix rhusiopathiae. It primarily affects pigs but can also infect other animals, including humans. The disease is characterized by skin lesions, fever, and joint inflammation.
diseases.prevention:
Vaccination,
          Good hygiene,
          Rodent control,
          Proper disposal of carcasses,
          Avoiding overcrowding

diseases.description: Newcastle disease is a contagious viral disease affecting birds, particularly poultry. It is caused by the Newcastle disease virus (NDV), which belongs to the Paramyxoviridae family. The disease can cause respiratory, neurological, and digestive symptoms in infected birds.
diseases.symptoms:
"Respiratory distress",
      "Neurological signs",
      "Decreased egg production",
      "Diarrhea",
      "Swelling of head and neck",
      "Sudden death"
diseases.treatment:
No specific treatment",
      "Supportive care",
      "Antibiotics for secondary infections"
diseases.prevention:
Vaccination",
      "Biosecurity measures",
      "Surveillance",
      "Proper disposal of dead birds",
      "Quarantine of new birds
